summary: This document is an email chain from July 2019, forwarded to a U.S. Attorney's office, containing a civilian complaint from Susan Harriman. She raises questions about Jeffrey Epstein's professional background at Bear Stearns and alleges a separate, unrelated case of potential securities fraud and medical misconduct involving Ivy League cardiologists and a Cayman Islands hedge fund.

persons.name: Susan Harriman
persons.role: Civilian complainant, former Bear Stearns employee
persons.context: Author of the original email raising questions about Jeffrey Epstein's licensing and alleging a separate case involving cardiologists and a hedge fund. She offers to present her findings in person.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The email questions whether he was ever properly licensed as a broker during his reported tenure at Bear Stearns, citing a FINRA Broker Check search.

persons.name: Gerardo Reyes
persons.context: Mentioned as having obtained records from Colombia related to the alleged cardiology research and hedge fund case.

persons.name: Melchiori
persons.role: U.S. Attorney's Office (NY Southern District) recipient
persons.context: Email is addressed to this individual at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS), indicating the complaint was forwarded for official review.

events.title: Susan Harriman's Email Complaint
events.description: Susan Harriman sends an email raising two issues: questioning Jeffrey Epstein's professional licensing history and alleging a separate case of fraud involving cardiologists and a hedge fund.

events.title: Complaint Forwarded to U.S. Attorney
events.description: The email chain, including Harriman's complaint, is forwarded within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, with a note about sending a standard response letter.

keyFacts: A civilian, Susan Harriman, questions whether Jeffrey Epstein was ever a licensed broker at Bear Stearns, citing a FINRA Broker Check search that showed no record for him.

Harriman alleges a separate, complex case involving two Ivy League Directors of Cardiology, a Cayman Islands hedge fund, Abbott Labs as an investor, and $150M in cash from Colombia for clinical trials.
The email was forwarded to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (Melchiori) for review as a potential complaint.
The document shows public tips and allegations were being sent to federal prosecutors regarding Epstein and other unrelated financial/medical cases in mid-2019.
